alert.note: Alert for Erie; Genesee; Niagara; Wyoming (New York) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued February 23 at 2:53PM EST until February 24 at 10:35AM EST by NWS Buffalo
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Buffalo NY has issued a Flood Warning for the following rivers in New York... Black Creek At Churchville affecting Monroe and Genesee Counties. Tonawanda Creek At Batavia affecting Wyoming, Erie, Niagara and Genesee Counties. Tonawanda Creek At Rapids affecting Erie and Niagara Counties. .Rain and snowmelt led to rising levels on creeks and rivers. Flows in rivers will increase quickly and reach critical levels. For the Black Creek...including Churchville...Minor flooding is forecast. For the Tonawanda Creek...including Attica, Batavia, Rapids...Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT FROM THIS EVENING TO LATE TOMORROW MORNING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Tonawanda Creek At Batavia. * WHEN...From this evening to late tomorrow morning. * IMPACTS...At 9.0 feet, Flood stage, some flooding in Batavia, possibly impacting Kibbe Park, Walnut Street, and Law Street. Flooding in rural areas of Alexander and the lowlands of the Alabama Swamps with some road closures likely. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 2:00 PM EST Wednesday the stage was 8.3 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage this evening to a crest of 9.3 feet just after midnight tonight. It will then fall below flood stage late tonight. - Flood stage is 9.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 9.0 feet on 11/25/2014. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued late tonight at 300 AM EST.
